moves.1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Bf4 e6 4. e3 c5 5: I was worried black might close the position with c4...
moves.7... Nc6 8. Ne5: trying to fork knight and bishop if knight should take e5...
moves.8... a6 9. Nxc6: with doubled pawns perhaps black is going to be less eager to close the center....
moves.9... bxc6 10. Nf3 cxd4 11. cxd4: I think white is slightly better here with the weak pawn on c6
moves.12... Bxg3 13. fxg3: black's defensive knight looks like it will be difficult to dislodge, so I opted to try and castle with the prospect of f-file pressure
moves.13... Ne4: a bit crude...better might have been ...e5 with ideas of bg4
moves.14. Bd3: preparing for castling with the possibility of shattering black's pawn structure.
moves.14... Nxd2 15. Qxd2 Qxd2+ 16. Kxd2: after this simplification white has the better bishop, but his pawns are much worse.  I was thinking about swinging my h-rook to f8, f4, then h4 and playing e4 to develop pressure on h7, but this probably would have been too slow.
moves.16... Rb8 17. b3 a5 18. a4: a bad blunder that swings the advantage decisively in black's favor.
a questionable pawn sac meant to open some lines to the black king.  I am playing desperately here.
moves.22... Rb2+ 23. Bc2 hxg4 24. h5 Ra2: threats of rook h-8 to b8 and then b2
moves.25. h6 gxh6 26. Rfh1 Kg7: and white's attack appears to have petered out...
moves.27. Rcb1 c5 28. Rb7 Rf7 29. Rhb1 Bxa4 30: better would have been just rook 7 to b6
moves.30... Kf6: black should have simplified and headed into a winning endgame.  it's probably no excuse, but both sides are under time pressure here.
moves.31... Rxc2+ 32. Kd3 Rxc5 33. Rxf7+ Kxf7: black has under a minute and i proceed to ignominiously harry him with a series of checks.
moves.34... Kf6 35. Rb8 Bd1: black misses another opportunity.  in retrospect, this game may be too sloppy to annotate...
black has the crushing a1=Q but runs out of time...
